result.execSummary:
The defendant Kailyun Demaro Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: 
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with 87 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, received, filed, & distributed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. spc

Count 1. 

(Return address:  Kailyun Jackson #424466, Racine Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 900, Sturtevant, WI  53177-0900).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 1, 2016, received and filed.  jm
Bail refund packet
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $2064.00 entered as ordered by the court on 07/15/2016  to pay $100.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/01/2018. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.

Defendant Kailyun Demaro Jackson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Patricia Irene Daugherty for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS 4 MONTHS with 87 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 4 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 87 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count. 

Sentencing Referral Form  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  GPS deviation. Court will address at next court date.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

**MATTER HEARD BY BR. 33 FOR BR. 22**

Matter before the Court to modify GPS monitoring in order that Defendant may participate in the PSI interview.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  COURT MODIFIED CONDITIONS OF THE GPS MONITORING TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO ATTEND THE PSI INVESTIGATION ON FRIDAY 05-20-2016 AT 6645 W MILL ROAD.  Matter remains calendared for Sentencing on 07-01-2016 at 08:30 am before Br. 22.
Ineligible Voting Notice received and filed.

Defendant Kailyun Demaro Jackson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  For reasons stated on the record, the "second and subsequent enhancer" in Count 2 is dismissed.  As to Counts 1 & 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 941.29(2)(a) and 939.50(3)(g), a Class G Felony.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 05/09/2016 at 9:00am.  State rescinded their offer.

Defendant Kailyun Demaro Jackson in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.
